column4: my usb broadband does not work it appears and i configure well but cant connect any help?? my usb is Qualcomm
You are trying with Network Manager > Mobile Broadband?. Which Modem do you have?. And which Ubuntu?
Is it a CDMA/EVDO connection, or GSM ?
Try by unchecking "Mobile Broadband" by right clicking on the network applet icon, and then connect
You mean it is disabled/Grayed out?. Did you create a new connection and filled all necessary details?
Can't you tell what modem it is by looking up its make and stuff on the modem itself?
There is no company name on the modem?
Do you have wvdial installed?
nope should i??
If you don't have internet access on that machine, either look for wvdial deb file in the cd, or download it on some other machine and copy it there.
okey already installing so what to do after that?
is gnome ppp okey
You can edit the file by "sudo gedit /etc/wvdial.conf" If you are having problem
gnome-ppp is fine if it can detect your modem
Can you post the contents of file "/etc/wvdial.conf?
i think it is ttyUSB02  since i use dmesg as i read in a topic in the net is what i did right???
http://paste.ubuntu.com/533082/
It could be that. Sometimes few modems are detected as usb mass storage devices, or detected as both storage device and the modem.
mmmmm so how we can know from the cofiguration file it tool the ttySL0 which i think is my regular modem
Can you edit that to : http://paste.ubuntu.com/533084/ While replacing "apn" with your apn, and phone number, username and password as well
And then try by "sudo wvdial".
Wait wait. You have a regular modem installed as well?
yup since i cant see from the gui where i can change those so i do it from the configuration file thx
Then wvdial made the file for that.
Just a sec
Try with http://paste.ubuntu.com/533087/ this. And edit the modem to ttyUSB02 if 01 doesn't work.
okey finish what to do next
sudo wvdial
ops cant no such file or directory in /dev/ttyUSB01 also for 02 maybe used by another application??? cant been access even with sudo i can see them in the terminal
Did you tried with USB1 and USB2?
oh my mistake it is ttyUSB1 and ttyUSB2
wait connecting
here what i get http://paste.ubuntu.com/533097/
If it shows some weird symbols and then some IP address, that means its connected.
The new config I sent you, http://paste.ubuntu.com/533087/, didn't have the +Fclass command. As I said, wvdial had configured for your PCI modem
No need. You just need the apn, username/psw and phone number to dial
I don't know about HSDPA, but for EDGE based GSM, it is either *99# or *99***1#
You might want to confirm the APN and number if you are not sure from your provider or their website
Oh wait,. gnome-ppp will have the same problem. It will detect your internal modem. Is there no way to disable that from the BIOS setup?
Any luck?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/533100/ this show that ttyUSB2 is the one right??
Probably, but not definitely. All USB modems install more than one tty
here what i get when connect using ttyUSB2 http://paste.ubuntu.com/533104/
i use ttyUSB0 and 1 and 2 and not working
Did you also try with ttyUSB0? You will also get could not get information from serial port, if some other program is trying to access the modem.
Make sure that Network Manager's connection entry is deleted and it is disabled
for ttyUSB0 i got diffrent erorr look http://paste.ubuntu.com/533108/

Which Ubuntu version are you using?. Up till 10.04, I could not use Network Manager to connect to my PCMCIA 3G CDMA modem (Which is connected to a PCI-PCMCIA adapter on my desktop). And I had to use gnome-ppp
i have laptop hp dv6 with ubuntu 10.10
That hints that modem is indeed at USB2 but is being used by some other program. BTW remove the "Init2 = ATQ0 V1 E1 S0=0 &C1 &D2"  and rename Init3 to 2 and then try
for IP how to make it dynamic ?
Did you tried by removing that Init2?. Didn't work?
it does not
That is normal AT commands for most GSM modems. I added that as your wvdialconf ran for your internal modem, otherwise it would have added the necessary init commands
Which provider are you using?
I would suggest you to remove the internal modem and run wvdialconf so it generates AT commands specific and supported by your modem. OR install gnome-ppp and see if it detects your modem.
but in gnome-ppp cant specify the username and password or anything
Run it as sudo. "sudo gnome-ppp"
i think it is the same problem as in the default network manager try and try and try without success

as I said, it will still detect your internal modem . Can you do "sudo modprobe usbserial vendor=0x05c6 product=0x9000" and then try? make sure that the vendor and product ids are the same as you got from lsusb
Not necessarily. I couldn't get mine connected in Network Manager in 10.04, but could with gnome-ppp/wvdial.
what if uninstall my modem drive? since it is closed source
Modem drive?
connected finally
How?.
LMAO. So Network manager was still trying to access the modem port.
also is there any way to disable a device from being identify by the kernel i forget that i am in linux
thx so much for your help
Congrats. And my pleasure.
really appreciated thx  i learn so much today
You first need to find the loaded module : sudo modprobe -l | grep "modem" OR sudo modprobe -l | grep "usb"
aha i understand this and read about it little how to add and remove modules so -l means to be unloaded???
-l is to list the device, grep shows you just the lines with the word "modem" in them.
sudo modprobe -r" is to remove

oh thx so much  can i ask you something it is really good when i face a problem then i can learn oh to tweek and handle things in linux but is there any source that make it little easier for me like even books that i can read

If you want to learn to fix stuff that you will face, the best thing to do is just ask and search for that specific problem on Internet. If you want to learn about Linux/Ubuntu in general, there are plenty of online guides and ebooks even. But I can't name anything specific as I have personally never tried them.
You will slowly learn the basic commands and how stuff works in linux as you use it more and more, and run into problems :).
No problem at all.
have little problem hehehehe my ubuntu does not recognize that connection so cant use it what to do?
are you using two connections on it?
i disconnet from my current connection so i can test the one using gnome ppa
or i should disable the whole network manager???
Did you try sudo wvdial?
That would be a good idea, but if it is not interfering with the modem now, it won't be the problem
i did use wvdial and now connected and get ip and defie DNS all stuff
so should i disconnect now and try to connect using it???
But you can't browse still? That is weird.
GSm providers usually give two APNs. one for WAP, and one for internet/computer. Did you use the Internet one?
it is okey working now
Glad to hear that
:). yeah it is. BTW unless you have an unlimited data package, using Mobile 3g/gsm connection on regular rates will be expensive
yup i dont like them also slow and expensive it is just for 2 days thats all
